timeline.body:
I think we can refactor this method a bit.

In L779 and L782 IMO we can call `isAssignable` instead of `isArrayTypesAssignable`.

AFAICT we can then change the first parameter of this method to a `BArrayType` (we'll probably have to deprecate this and introduce a new method). This'll reduce the number of specific checks and reuse the `isAssignable` logic, which has been tested quite a lot, more.

For unions, consider something like,

   int[] x = [1, 2];
   int|string[] y = x;

The current check will cause this assignment to pass right?

I think for unions we have to check isArrayTypesAssignable individually for each member and return true if at least one returns true.

        if (target.tag == TypeTags.UNION) {
            for (BType memberType : ((BUnionType) target).getMemberTypes()) {
                if (isArrayTypesAssignable(source, memberType, unresolvedTypes) {
                    return true;
                }
            }
            return false;
        }
